intro: Phemeranthus brachypodius, commonly known as the short-stemmed ephemeral, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom briefly. The plant has a short lifespan, often completing its life cycle within a single growing season. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ephemeral nature, it is often difficult to observe in the wild.
